channel.title: My First Chance with Ableton
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8J6plOItUzQ
Tell me what you think. Never really did any music producing before.
inb4shit

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:425620”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=528275.msg3855663#msg3855663 date=1324337808]
If I were you, I’d focus more on achieving certain sounds you have in mind rather than create a full length song.
[/quote]

Most people practice tweaking synths far too much and composition and arrangement nowhere near enough, tbh

EDIT: “theory only improves instinct” is crap. Almost everyone has innate music ability to improve, true tone deafness is rare. Music can be learned.[/quote]

I never said not to focus on arrangement. It was just my suggestion to begin by learning your way around the software instead of diving in head first.

btw, my new dnb song is kickass

Read full topic

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Rictoo:

If I were you, I’d focus more on achieving certain sounds you have in mind rather than create a full length song.

Most people practice tweaking synths far too much and composition and arrangement nowhere near enough, tbh

EDIT: “theory only improves instinct” is crap. Almost everyone has innate music ability to improve, true tone deafness is rare. Music can be learned.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Can you hum any note on the spot? Do you know your chords and scales? Believe me, theory only improves instinct.

Read full topic

item.description:

That is pretty nice but y’know what ya wanna do with that right? You wanna put a bangin’ donk on it!

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:6, topic:425620”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=528275.msg3853400#msg3853400 date=1324185832]

Do you even music theory bro?

It’s very simple, try some complex sounds in there.
[/quote]Like I said, idk how to use a piano yet… and again, my first time producing anything. A few hours of work, playing around with different things. I’ll get there. I used to play 7-string electric for a band and definitely contributed to song writing.

Go to your library and pick up a book on music theory, it will improve your sense of music at least tenfold.[/quote]I know the jist. We will get there though. Ihave an ear for things.

[quote=“Rictoo, post:7, topic:425620”]Sounds like you’re still getting acquainted with the software. If I were you, I’d focus more on achieving certain sounds you have in mind rather than create a full length song. Just play around with different VSTs, effects, etc for a while. That way, when you’re ready to make a real song, you’ll have the experience and knowledge necessary to make it sound decent.[/quote]I had just installed it, actually. I don’t want to work with VSTs just yet. I want to start creating things from scratch. I’m definitely focusing on just working on different elements though, good suggestion.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Sounds like you’re still getting acquainted with the software. If I were you, I’d focus more on achieving certain sounds you have in mind rather than create a full length song. Just play around with different VSTs, effects, etc for a while. That way, when you’re ready to make a real song, you’ll have the experience and knowledge necessary to make it sound decent.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:5, topic:425620”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=528275.msg3853259#msg3853259 date=1324181931]
Do you even music theory bro?

It’s very simple, try some complex sounds in there.
[/quote]Like I said, idk how to use a piano yet… and again, my first time producing anything. A few hours of work, playing around with different things. I’ll get there. I used to play 7-string electric for a band and definitely contributed to song writing. [/quote]

Go to your library and pick up a book on music theory, it will improve your sense of music at least tenfold.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Chance with Ableton
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I should change my sig to say “I was stoned”

And thank you. I’m going over a series of videos (FaderPro’s “Are you Able”) and doing my own ness as I go along with what he’s got goin’ on. I’m really bad at using a piano (My brother’s Axiom), so it’s a little difficult to apply what I have in my head, but… I’m workin’ on it

Read full topic
